reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars ALREADY ASSEMBLED STACK SHOE RACK BUT....
reviews.reviewText: As my headline stated. This shoe rack comes preassembled and all you have to do is stretch it out and click the locks on the sides of rack. And its good to go. It holds 6 pair of shoes or sneakers easily. The opening between each section is 6 1/4 inches. So it can only hold shoes no boots. It is all made of hard plastic. So it can crack if your not careful. But so far I've had no problems with this shoe rack. It holds 6 pairs of sneakers no problem. Just don't put any heavy boots and it will hold. Now the reason for the 4 stars. I had this on a rug that had a little fold on it. So I didn't notice it and I put this shoe rack on top of the fold and within a week I noticed that the shoe rack starting tilting on one side. So I moved it to a even floor and it corrected itself straight. So it does flex when not put on an even flooring. So an even floor is highly recommended when you place it. But this was designed to fit in small spaces and that's a plus.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Height can be adjusted
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed shoe rack! It turned out to be easier than I expected. Quite strong and has a brown wood grain. One pair of men's boots or 2 pairs of summer women's or children's shoes are placed on one platform. An added bonus is the ability to open and use as many shelves as needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Much More than Shoes!
reviews.reviewText: My hubby needed some small shelves next to his chair where his stuff could be handy. This exactly fit the space, and he loves it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A little flimsy but gets the job done.
reviews.reviewText: It stores shoes well but a little to small for boots. It does hold up well but it is a little wobbly and flimsy feeling. It is very easy to collapse and open back up which is nice. For the price I think it is worth it and gets the job done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars PHUNIGEEFT Foldable Small Shoe Rack
reviews.reviewText: Super easy to put together and perfect to organize my messy shoe pile near my front door.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good way to expand my shoe storage
reviews.reviewText: This foldable shoe rack works well for me to expand storing my shoes in my closet. It is tall and narrow, so it fits in a narrow space in my closet. It was fairly easy to assemble, just snap the pieces together. You have to make sure the sides are secure, or the tower will fall. The shoe openings are large enough to hold tennis shoes, flip flops, slides, slippers, or loafers. Ankle boots fit if you place them in a specific way (on their sides). I'd recommend placing this tower in a corner as it could fall over if you accidentally knock it. Also, the fake wood pattern is a little cheesy, but the shoe storage is functional, so I am ok with the looks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars nice shoe rack
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This shoe rack looks nicer in person. It goes well with our hardwood floor. It came pre-assembled. I just pull it up and lock the sides and back and it’s ready for use. It is versatile，good for shoes and other not too heavy items. It is great for small space.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This assembled easily and seems sturdy enough. It fits nicely in the closet for my husband's shoes. Shelves nicely accommodate his shoe sizes.
